Key Match Events: Ja Morant had 26 points, 14 assists, and 10 rebounds, helping the Memphis Grizzlies build a 31-point second-half cushion and beat the Milwaukee Bucks 122-99.
Giannis Antetokounmpo led the Bucks with 37 points and 11 rebounds, connecting on 17 of 22 shots.
Damian Lillard struggled with his shooting, going 1 for 12 in the game, including missing all six of his 3-pointers.
Post-Match Reflections: Morant expressed some frustration after Wednesday’s loss to the Nets.
Others: The Bucks were 9 for 42 from 3-point range, while Memphis finished the night at 52%.
The Grizzlies snapped a two-game skid with this victory.
Milwaukee has lost four straight games.
